intro: Orthoraphium coreanum subsp. kengii, commonly known as the Korean orthoraphium, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in forested areas and is often found in mountainous regions. Its leaves are simple and alternate, with a rough texture, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological features and limited distribution.
